headline.main: SPY DEFENDANT ACCUSES FBI MAN; Testifies Federal Agent Urged Him to Become Member of Communist Party REFUSED, HE DECLARES Admits Carrying Funds Abroad but Asserts He Did Not Suspect Espionage

lead_paragraph: Erich Strunck, a defendant in the espionage trial in Brooklyn, testified yesterday that William G. Sebold, counter-espionage agent for the Federal Bureau of Investigation and principal government witness, had urged him on two occasions to join the Communist party, as a means of safeguarding his job and because "communism has a great future in America."
abstract: E Strunck testifies on meetings with Sebold
